newsitem.title: USA: Ajay has no funds for preferred dividend.
newsitem.headline: Ajay has no funds for preferred dividend.

text.p: Ajay Sports Inc said Tuesday it has no funds immediately available to pay a dividend on its Series C 10 percent cumulative preferred stock for the first quarter ended March 31.
As a result, its board has not yet declared such a dividend.
Ajay also said its bank lender contends the company is in technical default under its loan agreement and the bank has restricted funds available to Ajay under the agreement.
Ajay said it is working with new lenders to replace its current bank and to increase the company's credit line.
Management and the board are monitoring the loan negotiations and will address the dividend payment issue after a new lender is found.
It said no other dividends on the company's capital stock may be paid until the accrued dividends on the Series C preferred stock are paid.
Ajay manufactures and markets leisure products, including Spalding golf bags, carts, gloves and accessories, Palm Springs Golf clubs and In-Motion casual furniture.
